definition: to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to row/to paddle/profitable/worth (the effort)/it pays (to do sth)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: Cathay by Ezra Pound is an epoch-making masterpiece in the history of modern poetry in the west.
sentences.chinese: 庞德的《华夏集》是西方现代诗歌史上划时代的作品。

sentences.english: The creation of the UN is an epoch-making event in human history.
sentences.chinese: 这是人类历史上具有划时代意义的创举。

sentences.english: The “great convergence” is an epoch-making transformation.
sentences.chinese: “大趋同”是一个划时代的转变。

sentences.english: This led to the next epochal shift.
sentences.chinese: 这导致了下一个划时代的转变。

sentences.english: Fill a blank in China, he is the oil age epoch-making progress.
sentences.chinese: 填补了国内空白，他是滤油时代的划时代的进步。

sentences.english: It was meant to sound like an epoch-making declaration.
sentences.chinese: 有意让它听起来像是一个划时代的宣言。

sentences.english: In the history of Chinese poem, Hu Shi's A Collection of Attempting Modern Langnage Poem is a sign of new era.
sentences.chinese: 在我国诗歌史上，胡适《尝试集》是划时代的标志。

sentences.english: The imperial examination system in the Tang Dynasty left a cross-age impact on the intellectual selection in China.
sentences.chinese: 唐代科举制度在中国选士制度史上有着划时代的意义。

sentences.english: The emergence of blue and white porcelain is of epoch-making significance in porcelain history.
sentences.chinese: 青花瓷的出现，在陶瓷史上具有划时代的意义。

sentences.english: Then, who will become the anti-aging revolution in the history of the epoch-making messenger?
sentences.chinese: 那么，谁将成为这场抗衰老史上划时代革命的信使呢？

sentences.english: In 1964 for post - war Japan was the epoch-making year.
sentences.chinese: 1964年对战后日本是具有划时代意义的一年。

sentences.english: It was an epoch-making event in our history.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的历史中它是个划时代事件。

sentences.english: Its epoch-making merit was that it propounded the problem.
sentences.chinese: 他的划时代的功绩在于提出了这个任务。

sentences.english: The Sydney Opera House is the mother and father of all modern landmark buildings.
sentences.chinese: 悉尼歌剧院是现代社会所有划时代建筑物的先驱。

definition: priority/sth advocated first/refers to ancient tradition: Worship the river first, then the sea.
one and only (idiom); rarely seen/unique of its kind
